benefits.title: Phytosterols of marine algae: Insights into the potential health benefits and molecular pharmacology.
benefits.summary: Algal sterols, particularly fucosterol, have potential health benefits such as anti-diabetes, anti-obesity, anti-Alzheimer's, antiaging, anticancer, and hepatoprotection due to their antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, immunomodul
benefits.journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology

benefits.title: Environmental life cycle comparison of algae to other bioenergy feedstocks.
benefits.summary: Algae have higher energy yields per area than terrestrial crops and can be more environmentally beneficial when combined with wastewater treatment and source-separated urine.

benefits.title: Biological activities and potential health benefits of sulfated polysaccharides derived from marine algae
benefits.summary: Sulfated polysaccharides derived from marine algae exhibit beneficial biological activities such as anticoagulant, antiviral, antioxidative, anticancer, and immunomodulating activities.

benefits.title: Neuroprotective Effects of Marine Algae
benefits.summary: Marine algae have neuroprotective effects such as antioxidant, anti-neuroinflammatory, cholinesterase inhibitory activity, and inhibition of neuronal death.

benefits.title: Integrated green algal technology for bioremediation and biofuel.
benefits.summary: Algae are promising candidates for alternative energy sources due to their photosynthetic abilities, favorable carbon life cycle, and potential for rural economic development.

benefits.title: Applications of microalgal and cyanobacterial biomass on a way to safe, cleaner and a sustainable environment
benefits.summary: Algae offer environmental benefits such as efficient land usage, CO2 sequestration, and resolving the food vs fuel feud, making them a viable option for various applications.

benefits.title: Neuroprotective Potentials of Marine Algae and Their Bioactive Metabolites: Pharmacological Insights and Therapeutic Advances
benefits.summary: Algal metabolites have pharmacological properties like antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, cholesterol homeostasis, protein clearance, and anti-amyloidogenic potentials, which confer neuroprotection against oxidative stress, neuroinflammation, mitochondrial dysfunction, and impaired proteostasis.

benefits.title: Beneficial Effects of Marine Algae-Derived Carbohydrates for Skin Health
benefits.summary: Marine algae-derived carbohydrates have potential skin health benefits for value-added cosmeceutical applications, including antioxidant, anti-melanogenic, and skin anti-aging properties.

benefits.title: Algae as New Kids in the Beneficial Plant Microbiome
benefits.summary: Algae have beneficial effects on plant health, such as plant growth promotion and disease control, as a member of the plant beneficial microbiome.

benefits.title: Life Cycle Environmental and Cost Impacts of Using an Algal Turf Scrubber to Treat Dairy Wastewater
benefits.summary: Algae can treat wastewater and produce energy products, potentially providing environmental and economic benefits.

side effects.title: Airborne Algal growth on roofs of membrane-structured residences in cold area of Japan
side effects.summary: Algal growth on roofs can cause discoloration and soiling, especially on the northeast and northwest sides of the roofs.

side effects.title: [From algae to "functional foods"].
side effects.summary: Possible side effects of algae in nutraceuticals include gastrointestinal issues, diarrhea, and bloating.

side effects.title: Determination of Microcystis aeruginosa Concentration Using Two Discrete Wavelengths
side effects.summary: Harmful algal blooms, specifically Microcystis aeruginosa, can cause irritation, nausea, and vomiting in humans, and more severe side effects in smaller organisms.

side effects.title: Algae and associated toxins & metabolites: methodology for risk assessment and risk management
side effects.summary: Algae negatively impact water quality parameters, operational issues, and customer satisfaction, causing taste and odour causing compounds.

side effects.title: Toxic effect and bioremediation of oil contamination in algal perspective
side effects.summary: Algae can metabolize long chain toxic chemicals and their derivatives, breaking them down to smaller and nontoxic units, contributing to oil contamination remediation.

side effects.title: Structural diversity, biosynthesis, and health-promoting properties of brown algal meroditerpenoids
side effects.summary: Brown algae-derived meroterpenoids have protective effects against oxidative stress, inflammation, cancer, obesity, diabetes, and neurodegenerative disorders.

side effects.title: Interaction of silver nanoparticles with algae and fish cells: a side by side comparison
side effects.summary: AgNP exposure affects proteins in both algae and fish cells, with algae having a cell wall barrier to particle uptake and fish cells taking up AgNP via endocytic pathways.

side effects.title: Algae Distribution on the HVDC Composite Insulator and the Influence of Algal Activity on Electrical Characteristics of Silicone Rubber
side effects.summary: Algal growth significantly reduces the hydrophobicity of silicone rubber, affecting its electrical properties.

side effects.title: Algae and cardiovascular health
side effects.summary: Consuming seaweed and functional meat-containing algae may improve cholesterol, lipoprotein levels, blood pressures, and antioxidant availability.

side effects.title: Medicinal Prospects of Antioxidants From Algal Sources in Cancer Therapy
side effects.summary: Algae can be considered as alternative natural sources of antioxidants, potentially aiding in cancer therapy and alleviating side effects.

dosage.title: Enhanced algae removal by drinking water treatment of chlorination coupled with coagulation
dosage.summary: Algae can be removed with a coagulant dosage of 13 mg L1 when the algae density in raw water is less than 1.0  106 cells L1 and with a dosage of approximately 20 mg L1 and 4.0 mg L1, respectively, during algae outbreak period.

dosage.title: Effect of temperature on algal removal from wastewater stabilization ponds by alum coagulation
dosage.summary: High alum dosage is required for effective algae removal in wastewater stabilization ponds, but increased temperatures negatively affect the percentage removal of algal cells.

dosage.title: Prevention of experimental oral cancer by extracts of Spirulina-Dunaliella algae.
dosage.summary: The algae extract was delivered by mouth in dosages of 140 micrograms in 0.4 ml mineral oil three times per week.

dosage.title:
Kinetic Modeling of Peroxydisulfate Pre-Treatment of Algae Slurry (Pasir Gudang, Malaysia)
for Increasing Methane Generation from Anaerobic Digestion: Fertilizer Recovery
dosage.summary: A dose of 0.02 g peroxydisulfate/g algal sludge TSS produces the most accumulative methane after 61 days of fermentation.

dosage.title: Bioremoval of Methylene Blue from Aqueous Solutions by Green Algae (Bracteacoccus sp.) Isolated from North Jordan: Optimization, Kinetic, and Isotherm Studies
dosage.summary: The maximum removal efficiency of methylene blue (96%) was achieved at optimum conditions with algae dosage (0.06 g mL1) and temperature (30°C) after 60 minutes of contact time.

dosage.title: Evaluation of Flocculation, Sedimentation, and Filtration for Dewatering of Scenedesmus Algae
dosage.summary: The study focused on thickening algae from a culture concentration range of 0.4 to 1 g L-1 to an end-product concentration range of 15 to 50 g L-1.

dosage.title: Bio-sorption of toxic metals from industrial wastewater by algae strains Spirulina platensis and Chlorella vulgaris: Application of isotherm, kinetic models and process optimization.
dosage.summary: Algae strains Spirulina platensis and Chlorella vulgar can remove toxic metals from wastewater with adsorbent dosages ranging from 0.2-2.5 g.
dosage.journal: The Science of the total environment

dosage.title: Food Safety Evaluation: Acute Oral and Dermal Effects of the Algae Scenedesmus acutus and Spirulina platensis on Albino Rats.
dosage.summary: Up to 800 mg/kg of body weight of algae were administered to rats orally without causing toxic effects.

dosage.title: Effect of Algae with Iodine Excess on Thyroid Function in Iodine Deficiency Wistar Rats
dosage.summary: 3 times of dosage Algae group showed higher serum TT3 value and TT4 value compared to the conventional dosage Algae group.
dosage.journal: Chinese Archives of Traditional Chinese Medicine

dosage.title: The Selective Use of Hypochlorite to Prevent Pond Crashes for Algae‐Biofuel Production
dosage.summary: A chlorine dosage between 0.45 to 0.6 mg Cl/L and a dosing interval of two hours created the necessary chlorine concentrations to inhibit predation while letting the algae grow.
